oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Home Week, Marlboro, New York
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Looking south on Western Avenue during Old Home Week celebrations in Marlboro. A horse and a wagon are in front of Warren's Market, a small automobile is on the side of the street, and two horses pulling something not in the photo are in the street. Flags and patriotic banners fly from buildings and wires. Several people are on the street and sidewalks. B. Herberich Bakery is in the Berean Building.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Farmerettes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three young women are in a car and a fourth is holding a bucket. These young women are farmerettes. A fifth person, a young girl, is watching the women and the car. oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four rows of men in uniforms are in a room with a clock, a patriotic banner, and photos and certificates in frames. The photo is hand-labeled in white, "Co. 50, U.R. oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Home Week, Marlboro, New York
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A parade down Main Street (Route 9W) during Old Home Week in Marlboro. A group of young girls dressed in white are pulling a small cart with flowers. A woman walks beside the girls. Behind them are four women on foot, followed by several cars. Cars are parked along the street, some with people inside watching the parade. Flags and patriotic banners are on cars, buildings, and utility poles. One building has a sign that reads "Rubber tire repairing."
